intro: Thlaspi nasturtium, commonly known as yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically basal, with a slightly hairy surface and a peppery scent when crushed. Thlaspi nasturtium is often found growing in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
